samples.context: In case fertilisation occurs, the zygote is allowed to develop for about a week and then it is placed in the mother’s uterus. Complete development takes place in the uterus and the baby is born like any other baby. Babies born through this technique are called test-tube babies.
samples.question: What are babies born from IVF called?

samples.context: Though these animals lay hundreds of eggs and release millions of sperms, all the eggs do not get fertilised and develop into new individuals. This is because the eggs and sperms get exposed to water movement, wind and rainfall.
samples.question: What challenges do external fertilisation eggs face?

samples.context: Production of large number of eggs and sperms is necessary to ensure fertilisation of at least a few of them. External fertilisation involves laying hundreds of eggs.
samples.question: Why do animals use external fertilisation?

samples.context: In case fertilisation occurs, the zygote is allowed to develop for about a week and then it is placed in the mother’s uterus. Babies born through this technique are called test-tube babies.
samples.question: How long does a zygote develop before implantation?

samples.context: Also, there are other animals in the pond which may feed on eggs. All the eggs do not get fertilised and develop into new individuals due to various factors.
samples.question: Why is not every egg fertilised in external fertilisation?

samples.context: Complete development takes place in the uterus and the baby is born like any other baby. In Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) involves placing a zygote in the mother’s uterus.
samples.question: Where does complete development occur in IVF?
